description.en: The HDGI ontology aims to model the pose and/or movement of human upper limbs that are used to interact with devices (particularly with device affordances). It is mapped around gestures performed by human's upper limb region to interact with these affordances. While allowing these mapping the ontology is also developed to be used as a dictionary for manufacturers, designers and developer community to browse and locate commonly used gestures to command certain affordances, or/and to understand the connections and dynamics around it. This ontology is made accessible, flexible and extendable enabling device manufacturers, designers and users to incorporate new gestures and map the relations to corresponding affordances accordingly. The ontology is geared at mapping the ubiquitousness in gesture vocabularies by linking them appropriately and does not enforce designers and manufacturers to follow a standard.

comment.en: Fourth finger or the fourth digit of hand.
The local coordinate system is the coordinate system that is convenient for a given entity (Finger, palm etc.), local space, or object space.
Second finger or the second digit of hand.
The forearm is the line between the elbow joint and the wrist.
The act of moving a certain body part towards a certain direction.

A quaternion is defined as q = w + xi + yj + zk where w, x, y, and z are real numbers and i is defined as square root of -1. With quaternions, i = j = k = square root of -1.

The magnitude of a quaternion is calculated by magnitude = square root of (w2 + x2 + y2 + z2). For the unit quaternions, the magnitude is one.

example.value: thumb, middle finger, left ring finger etc

comment.en: A finger is a body part of the human body and a type of digit.
A device denotes a piece of hardware or software which consists of sensors or actuators or both.

comment.undefined: Position of a pose in a particular time

comment.en: Third finger or the third digit of hand.
The area located at the end of the forearm (starting from wrist) up until the start of a finger which is the central region of the anterior part of the hand.

comment.undefined: Movement of palm. Either right or left.

comment.en: Affordances are all the type of properties that belong to devices. They indicate the possible actions users can take with it.
Fifth finger or the fifth digit of hand.
A gesture is a movement or a pose of the fingers and/or palm and/or upper arm and/or forearm.

comment.undefined: Gestures (movements) made with fingers and palms

comment.en: The upper arm is the line between the shoulder and elbow joint.
Human body. A collection of body parts.

comment.undefined:
Frame of reference or the initial center.
Location of the (0,0,0) postion related to the given coordinates.

In an equation where quaternion (q) = w + xi + yj + zk, where w, x, y, and z are all real numbers k-component = z

In the euqation 'i' is defined as sqrt(-1). With quaternions, i = j = k = sqrt(-1).
Represents the amount of rotation which will occur about this axis defined by (i-component, j-component, k-component). Known as scalar component.
Relation from a Human to a User Context or from a Device to a Device Context.

In an equation where quaternion (q) = w + xi + yj + zk, where w, x, y, and z are all real numbers j-component = y

In the euqation 'i' is defined as sqrt(-1). With quaternions, i = j = k = sqrt(-1).
Relation from a Human to a User Context or from a Device to a Device Context.
Relation from a Affordance to a Device describing the affordances of a device.

In an equation where quaternion (q) = w + xi + yj + zk, where w, x, y, and z are all real numbers and i-component = x

In the euqation 'i' is defined as sqrt(-1). With quaternions, i = j = k = sqrt(-1).
